clinical_study.brief_title: Autonomic Nervous System Activity, Aging and Sleep Apnea/Hypopnea
clinical_study.official_title: Autonomic Nervous System Activity, Aging and Sleep Apnea/Hypopnea in a Prospective Cohort of Subjects Aged 67 Years

lead_sponsor.agency: Centre Hospitalier Universitaire de Saint Etienne

clinical_study.source: Centre Hospitalier Universitaire de Saint Etienne

brief_summary.textblock:
The regulatory effects of the autonomic nervous system (ANS) concern almost all organs which permanently feed information back to this global biological vigilance system controlling allostasis. Heart rate fluctuations are highly dependent on ANS control, making the heart one of the best indicators of ANS activity.
Low ANS activity level is associated with severe cardiac and cerebral events, as well as to death from any cause in the general population. It is even associated with sleep apnea/hypopnea.

detailed_description.textblock: The main goal of this SYNAPSE study is to evaluate, on a selected prospective cohort of subjects aged 67 years upon study entry, the incidence of sleep apnea/hypopnea and the prognostic values of ANS activity levels measured at preset times and of cardiovascular or cerebrovascular events.

primary_outcome.measure: Composite criterion : fatal and non-fatal cardiovascular or cerebrovascular events

secondary_outcome.measure: Presence and relationship of sleep apnea/hypopnea and clinically silent stroke revealed through brain MRI

arm_group.description: This cohort is the same than the PROOF study (NCT00759304). Subjects were recruited amongst the inhabitants of the city of Saint-Etienne, France, and were eligible if aged 65 at the inclusion date in the PROOF study

intervention.description: Simultaneous 24-hour ambulatory electrocardiogram and polygraphic recordings performed at home during a night.

study_pop.textblock: Subjects were recruited amongst the inhabitants of the city of Saint-Etienne, France, and were eligible if aged 65 at the inclusion date in the PROOF study

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- informed consent signed
- to participate in the PROOF study
Exclusion Criteria:
- prior myocardiac infarction
- prior stroke
- hearth failure
- atrial fibrillation
- insulin-treated diabetes mellitus
- cardiac pacemaker
- disease limiting life expectancy to < 5 years
- contraindication to brain MRI
- living in an institution
- respiratory failure with oxygenotherapy
- sleep-related breathing disorders known and treated
